rule: The output is not a single string containing only the part-of-speech tag corresponding to the given word in the provided sentence.
validityText:
The input consists of a sentence "He bought apples." and a word "apples". According to the input specification, the sentence can be any string of words and it may include punctuation and symbols. In this case, the sentence "He bought apples." meets this criterion. The word provided is "apples", which is explicitly present in the sentence without any modification (not a substring of any other word or missing due to punctuation separation). Thus, the word is present in the sentence as required by the input specification. There are no discrepancies or violations of the input rules; therefore, based on the detailed evaluation, the input complies with the input specifications.

OK
